data.title: Convert Networking to RakNet
data.body:
RFC:

I've done this, it works on NinjaSnowWar. This is about if it's really worth it or not? The change was not interface breaking beyond code touching networking and was largely straightforward (completed in approx. 4 hours).

Are RakNet's features worth the change? Such as LAN discovery which kNet cannot do?

data.title: Audio, add support for multichannel output
data.body:
RFC:

The addition of support to the audio system for 5.1/7.1/etc output (I can only test 5.1). Additionally the capability to specify a sound to output only to the "low"-channel (subwoofer) if it is mono.

This is an API breaking change as it replaces Mono/Stereo bools with an enum for the speaker-mode (could be called channel-mode).

data.title: Add Compute support
data.body:
RFC:

The addition of GPU/CPU Compute. I propose the optional addition of OpenCL as a GPU/CPU compute option through a generic "Compute" interface. That interface being tightly tied to the "ComputeDevice" any instance was instantiated against (support of using both CPU and GPU devices). By "tightly tied" I mean that buffers assigned for a CPU device will reject and present errors when attempting to bind it to a GPU device occurs (as well as the opposite case).

OpenCL is shortstop for longer term GPGPU support, and has broader support than OpenGLs compute capabilities and has much larger mobile reach. This addition will make the implementation of tiled deferred and tiled forward/forward+ more viable. It will also provide opportunities to speed up particle simulation and bone calculations.

I'm prepared both for the PR and to add a naive-surface-nets example that demonstrates running NSN in CPU vs NSN in "best-found-compute" device.

It's important that this not be one entity, as there are good reasons for using both a CPU and GPU compute device.

I do not see this becoming anything core other than the core tracking the "attached" compute devices. Compute is a very specialized matter, and realistically doesn't warrant script exposure.

data.title: Add cubemap convolution routines
data.body:
PR, ready this is an RFC.

Image class already supports cubemaps structurally. Convolution filters through the mip chain could be specified for filtering mips via cubemap solid angle.

This is a non-trivial issue, as cubemap filtering should depend on the BRDF used. I propose the addition of a downsampling routine to image that includes a function pointer (this is naturally not a process for scripting) that performs the 2x2 to 1x1 reduction. This can replace the existing mipmap generation routines and will make those much more flexible, a default routine should be assumed for mip generation of course.

Cubemap renderer for zones should also probably expand FOV by Castano's method for the Witness to reduce seam issues a bit more.

data.title: Add convolution filter support to Image class
data.body:
PR ready, this is for comment before submission.

Image class should support clone based application of matrix convolution filters. Float matrices should be assumed to be already in fractional form, an overload for int matrices should assume that it must divide by the highest integer specified ([5, 64, 5] form).

Items of discussion are mostly just about forms of convolution matrix submission and if detection of separability is necessary.

data.title: JS: Add IES cookie generation to RampGenerator
data.body:
Adds Gobo/Cookie baking from IES files to RampGenerator.

Part of a series of PRs I'll submit for old functionality I'd like to see merged in.

**Note:** I couldn't figure out how to filter these based purely on the data, the blur could be removed if someone else can sort out this lat/lon ray thing better, I never found a method that dealt with it robustly enough (bollard lights break everything). Blurring is generally sufficient.

I'll be opening a series of issues, they won't be actual issues but more matters of serious discussion regarding merging such as OpenCL, Texture cube arrays, geom/hull/dom shaders, etc.

data.title: Take advantage of AppVeyor cache mechanism to speed up CI build
data.body: Our free AppVeyor account only allows one VM at a time causing the CI build requests to queue up and clear slowly. Not sure whether we can still ask AppVeyor to provide us with more computing resource for free or not, but one thing for sure we can try to take advantage of its cache mechanism for our own benefit.

data.title: The auto-discovery of CMake variables for MinGW platform seems to be not reliable
data.body: From the new MinGW-CI build test result, it appears that the detection mechanism failed on 64-bit SHARED build configuration. The downstream project failed to detect that URHO3D_TESTING should be set, among others.

data.title: 42_PBRMaterials built with 32-bit MinGW compiler toolchain is not runnable
data.body: Continued discussion from #1765. The new MinGW-CI build consistently shows that 42_PBRMaterials crashed during test run.

data.title: RigidBody2D doesn't preserve b2Body* body_ field on moving from one scene to another
data.body:
Imagine, you have a Node with RigidBody2D component on a scene1.
You try to move it to some node of scene2
`someNode->AddChild(nodeWithRigidBody);`

In that case we see this code
`        // If old parent is in different scene, perform the full removal`
`        if (oldParent->GetScene() != scene_)`
`            oldParent->RemoveChild(node);`

which removes the node with components from the old scene.

The problem is that in such removing we lose body_ object from RigidBody2D, because on removing the function ReleaseBody() is called.
It results in wrong RigidBody2D component in a new node.
Unfortunately, I didn't manage how to fix it myself.

data.title: Multisampling with DX11 renderer on DX10 hardware
data.body:
Multisampled texture creation is failed.

Log message: 
"ERROR: Failed to create texture (HRESULT 80070057)"

DX11 debug message:
"D3D11 ERROR: ID3D11Device::CreateTexture2D: The Sample descriptor is invalid for a D3D10.0 level driver. DXGI_SAMPLE_DESC::Count (value = 8) must be between 1 and 32, inclusively. For 8 samples, the current graphics implementation only supports DXGI_SAMPLE_DESC::Quality (value = -1) less than 17. <-- if 0 is shown here for Quality, this means the graphics implementation doesn't support this number of samples. Use CheckMultisampleQualityLevels to detect what the graphics implementation supports. [ STATE_CREATION ERROR #93: CREATETEXTURE2D_INVALIDSAMPLES]"

The problem is how multisampling quality is specified.
SampleDesc.Quality == 0xffffffff is not valid value for DX10.
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb173072(v=vs.85).aspx

data.title: Improve Box2D joints handling, fixes #1787
data.body: This PR contains improved handling for several constraints. I checked it in Urho2DConstraints example and it seems to work fine. Moreover I have added SetLimit and GetLimit for distance constraint.

data.title: BillboardSet with fixed screen size doesn't update properly.
Asset Importer Animation Import Bug
data.body:
Hello, 

Today i have tried to import a 3D animated model with 6 animations. 

The asset importer tool produced 7 files (the base model and it's animations).

The problem is that every animation produced had the same length and it was the length of the first animation. 

I have commented this line "duration = importEndTime_ - importStartTime_;" (line 1295 in AssetImporter.cpp) and everything worked correctly. All animation were using their correct lenght.

Any idea why this is happening ? 

Thanks !

data.title: Editor: incorrect work with UIElement vars.
data.body:
Editor doesn't show values of newly added UIElement vars. UILayout reload solves this problem, but it's very inconvenient to save and reload layout all the time. To reproduce the bug:
1. Create `UIElement` in Urho3D Editor.
2. Add var `MyVar` with type `String` (or any other type, it doesn't matter) to this element using  Attribute Inspector.
3. Set value `XXX` to `MyVar`.
4. In attribute inspector window value of `MyVar` will be empty. But if you save layout, `MyVar` will be saved with value `XXX`. Also, if you press refresh button in Attribute Inspector, `MyVar` will disappear from this window.

data.title: Box2D joints handling bug
data.body:
The way Box2D joints are handled by Urho is not valid. For now every time some joint parameter is changed, the joint gets recreated. It involves destruction of an old object, change of joint definition and then creation of a new joint with altered parameters. For most cases it might be a good way to handle this, despite the fact this is not so performant.

But some joints have internal state which gets lost during the process. For example the prismatic joint with its lower and upper translation. Limits are computed for rigid bodies during the creation of a prismatic joint. If bodies move away during the simulation (due to gravity or a motor) and then joint gets recreated, the limits are computed again but for bodies in other positions, which stretches (or narrows) the limits creating strange behaviors.

I tried to change the joint parameter directly (for example a motor speed) without joint recreation and then it worked correctly. Are there any other reasons this is not implemented this way?

data.title: IntVector3
data.body:
Hello.

I quickly created this code for one of my projects, and I haven't actually tested it at all. At least it compiles. I copied the code from IntVector2, so it might miss some functionality that is needed with three dimensions.

If you want, you can merge it, but I'm also happy to make any improvements you might suggest.

data.title: graphics->SetTexture() order
fixes #1781 - Moved SDL_Init() into Context class
data.body: ```SDL_Init()``` and ```SDL_Quit()``` are now located in the ```Context``` class. Urho3D subsystems can use ```context_->RequireSDL(SDL_INIT_SUBSYSTEM);``` and ```context_->ReleaseSDL()``` in their constructor/destructors if they require the use of SDL functions. The ```Context``` class globally keeps track of the number of calls to ```RequireSDL()``` so it knows when to call ```SDL_Quit()```

data.title: Move SDL_Init() into Context
data.body:
As discussed here: http://discourse.urho3d.io/t/sdl-init-doesnt-get-called-in-headless-mode/2746

Will submit a PR.
